alert.note: Alert for Coastal Brazoria; Coastal Galveston; Coastal Harris; Fort Bend; Galveston Island; Inland Brazoria; Inland Galveston; Inland Harris (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 08 at 5:39PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT GALVESTON...SOUTHEASTERN FORT BEND...NORTHEASTERN BRAZORIA AND SOUTHERN HARRIS COUNTIES THROUGH 630 PM CST... At 538 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bonney, or 13 miles northwest of Angleton, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... League City, Galveston Causeway, Texas City, southern Friendswood, Alvin, Dickinson, La Marque, Santa Fe, Webster, Hitchcock, southern Manvel, Kemah, Bayou Vista, Iowa Colony, Tiki Island, Hillcrest, Liverpool, Bonney, San Leon, and Bacliff. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CST for southeastern Texas.
